intro: Nasa carnea, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant pink to purple flowers that open in the morning and close in the evening. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces slender, winding vines that can climb or trail along the ground. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Nasa carnea thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
